Package controllers

Class AlbumController

java.lang.Object
controllers.AlbumController
public class AlbumController
extends java.lang.Object
This page will allow user to complete functions such: create, open, edit, delete an albums.
Author:
Hunter Brady, Alex Rivera

  • Method Details

    • start

      public void start​(javafx.stage.Stage mainStage) throws java.lang.ClassNotFoundException, java.io.IOException
      Parameters:
      mainStage - the stage (Album View) in which the application will display
      Throws:
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - produced when no definition for the class with the specified name could be found.
      java.io.IOException - produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations

    • initData

      public void initData​(UserList ul, int i)
      User list initialization. This method keeps track of the current user and album that the application is being operated on.
      Parameters:
      ul - user list parameter
      i - index in which the user is positoned in the list

    • delAlbum

      public void delAlbum​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws java.io.IOException
      This method implements logic to delete Albums. The album to be deleted must be selected prior to the delete album action. If the album list is empty at the moment the action is taken, the user will be prompted a warning.
      Parameters:
      e - this is the event handler (delete Album button) that is triggered upon user action
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations

    • create

      public void create​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws java.io.IOException
      Create album method allows the user to create a new album in the application. Users will not be allowed to have duplicate albums but the same album name can be used across different users.
      Parameters:
      e - this is the event handler (Create Album button) that is triggered upon user action
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations

    • rename

      public void rename​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws java.io.IOException
      Rename album method allow the user to rename albums. If the user renames an album with the same name as an existing album, the user will be prompted with a warning
      Parameters:
      e - this is the event handler (Rename Album button) that is triggered upon user action
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - IOException produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations

    • open

      public void open​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      On action triggered by the Open button, this method will take the user to the Thumbnail view
      Parameters:
      e - this is the event handler (Open Album button) that is triggered upon user action
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - IOException produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - produced when no definition for the class with the specified name could be found.

    • logout

      public void logout​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      Method to logout. It is set to take the user back to the Login page
      Parameters:
      e - this is the event handler (Logout button) that is triggered upon user action
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - IOException produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - produced when no definition for the class with the specified name could be found.

    • search

      public void search​(javafx.event.ActionEvent e) throws java.io.IOException, java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
      Search method will be triggered via the Search button and it will guide the user to the Search View Page in which the user will be able to perform a variety of searches
      Parameters:
      e - e this is the event handler (Search button) that is triggered upon user action
      Throws:
      java.io.IOException - IOException produced by failed or interrupted I/O operations
      java.lang.ClassNotFoundException - ClassNotFoundException produced when no definition for the class with the specified name could be found.

    • checkAlbum

      public boolean checkAlbum​(java.util.ArrayList<Album> alb, java.lang.String s)
      This method checks for duplicate album names. If the name of a new album matches the name of an existing album, the return value will be true and false if otherwise
      Parameters:
      alb - an array list of albums
      s - name of the album passed to a String
      Returns:
      true if new album equals existing album and false if otherwise
